thread.title: Crystal Palace boss weighing up move for Uruguay defender Martin Caceres
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace boss weighing up move for Uruguay defender Martin Caceres

author: gsweet
title: Crystal Palace boss weighing up move for Uruguay defender Martin Caceres
text:
Comments CRYSTAL PALACE are keen on former Juventus defender Martin Caceres. 
It seems that Caceres, who also played for Barcelona, is set to link up with Palace for training so that boss Sam Allardyce can assess his fitness levels. Getty Images Martin Caceres…defensive target for Crystal Palace 
Big Sam will then decide whether to offer him a short-term deal. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Crystal Palace news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Caceres, 29, is still a free agent after leaving Juventus last summer when his contract expired. 
A number of clubs have been linked with him, but the Uruguayan has not taken up any of the offers. 
He is now keen to fix himself up with a new club, and struggling Palace are ready to offer him the chance to play in the Premier League. Related Stories UNITED ON FIRE Emergency services rush to Old Trafford as smoke pours from Manchester United's Sir Bobby Charlton stand Gordon blue Chelsea make second bid for Celtic keeper Craig Gordon as Asmir Begovic replacement ROO LEAVING? Wayne Rooney's Manchester United future in doubt as Jose Mourinho also confirms Ashley Young could leave Scouting with Girls Pep Guardiola watches Monaco play PSG alongside Russian supermodel Victoria Lopyreva ahead of Champions League tie Make it a double Leicester want Gaston Ramirez and Anderlecht's £13m Kara Mbodji before window shuts 
Allardyce is understandably desperate to strengthen his defence as he has yet to win a league game since taking over at Selhurst Park. 
And Caceres offers flexibility as he can play anywhere across the back line and he boasts a wealth of experience. Getty Images Caceres failed to hold down regular spot at Juventus Crystal Palace 0-3 Manchester City : Palace no match for City and go crashing out Reuters 3 Sam Allardyce is looking to bolster a leaky defence 
The defender still has plenty to offer despite having failed to nail down a regular berth with the Old Lady during his five years in Turin. 
He joined the Italian champions on loan from Barcelona in 2009/10 and started 95 league games - 37 of them on loan at Sevilla - over seven seasons in a career that, in truth, has never really taken off.
